programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Vertical Gauntlet Rat Hat Semi Truck Beam Walk" - Contestants must traverse a narrow beam, place their heads in a rat-filled box and cross between two moving trucks.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Traverse The Dam, Bee Headed, Water Coffin" - Are you worth a Dam? Suspended high over a dam is a 350-foot long tightrope with flags attached. Contestants would have to cross the tightrope and collect flags while holding on to a higher tightrope for support. The two men and the two women to collect the most flags in 5 minutes would advance to the next round. Stunt 2 is a real Bee. The ones left are covered with over 200,000 honeybees. Once covered, they would have stand for 2 minutes covered in bees. All contestants who completed this stunt would advance to the finals. For the finale, contestants are locked inside a Plexiglas box full of holes and submerged underwater. Once a red light came on, they would have to figure out which of 2 keys unlocked the coffin and swim to the surface. The contestant to complete this stunt the fastest would be the Fear Factor Champion.

programme.title: The Guys Next Door
programme.desc: Who, among us, can say that we come from a "normal" family? The Guys Next Door, a feature length documentary, offers an alternative to the traditional ideas of what constitute the nuclear American family. Meet Erik and Sandro, a gay couple with two daughters birthed by their friend Rachel with donor eggs. In her 40s, Rachel is married to Tony and they have three biological children of their own. Rachel and Tony, a seemingly traditional married couple, live in the suburbs of Massachusetts with their children. Inspired by a TV program about the difficulties and costs associated with gay couples having children, Rachel, age 41, volunteers to be a surrogate - not once, but twice within two years - for Erik, her good friend from college, and his husband Sandro, an Italian émigré. This film begins when Rachel is eight months pregnant with Erik and Sandro's second daughter, Eleonora. What compels a woman in her forties with three children of her own to carry children for friends? What is the reaction of her husband and children? And, how will Erik and Sandro handle the challenges of parenting two girls in a world that still emphasizes the importance of maternal instinct? The issues raised in this film - gay marriage and parenting, surrogacy as a path for gays and lesbians to have children, and the extension and redefinition of what it means to be "an American family" - remain relevant as our country is a cultural battleground during the divisive 2016 presidential election. The Guys Next Door is a powerful antidote to the negative backlash and hateful rhetoric aimed at same sex families. In the words of the esteemed documentary filmmaker Ross McElwee (Sherman's March), "with nuance, verve and humor, this film goes well beyond issues of surrogacy and gay parenthood and explores the humanity that connects us all."

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Twist" - When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Decisions" - Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Storms" - It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Bruised And Battered" - A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Storms" - It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Flaw" - Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Dive" - A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Decent" - It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Mark Fair left for work and his fiancée, Karla Brown, stayed home. Later, he found her dead. During the autopsy, bite marks on her body were re-examined and forensic odontology identified the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Janice Johnson was found dead at the foot of her basement stairs. Police in Nova Scotia had to unravel the circumstances surrounding Janice's death and answer the question: Was it an accident or murder?

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Fire engulfs the home where Lori Keidel and her siblings were left alone while their father went to the laundromat. Years after her mother's disappearance, Lori tells police she witnessed her mother's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Young Navajos in the Southwest were dying at an alarming rate. The tribe's medicine men provided investigators with a critical clue that would lead halfway around the world to a most unlikely killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 4
programme.desc: Edward Post drew a bath for his wife before going for a run. He returned to find her not breathing. She died before emergency response arrived. Police considered her death accidental until a motive surfaced.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When the wife of a well-known dentist is found dead, police struggle to identify a suspect. Some fibers and a study of the weather patterns on the night of the murder break the case open and reveal the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When Joann Katrinak is found dead in a corn field with her infant son, the obvious suspect is the husband and father of the victims. But insects found on the bodies reveal a vital clue which uncovers a twisted story of passion gone wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When a decomposed body is found stuffed in a barrel, it's easy to presume murder. But the body had been placed in the barrel 30 years earlier. One of the few clues was an address book found along with the body.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When a policeman's house goes up in flames, experts suspect arson. The officer whose home was torched arrests low-level drug dealer James Wren, who confesses. But when the suspect vanishes, investigators question the authenticity of the confession.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When police find the body of 11-year-old Krista Harrison, there are few clues to the killer's identity. But authorities are intrigued by unusual orange fibers embedded in clothing found near the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: This examination of the role autopsies play in murder investigations focuses on the suspicious death of Virginia Ridley. Police charge her mentally unstable husband with murder, but a medical examiner discovers that she died of natural causes.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: An investigation of a pediatrician, prompted by the mysterious death of one of her patients, leads to a Texas hospital where the pediatric mortality rate is higher than at any hospital in the country.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Police suspect Dr. John "Jack" Boyle in the disappearance of his wife, Noreen, when he signs mortgage papers for a new house with a woman pretending to be his spouse. The police later find Noreen's body in the basement of Dr. Boyle's new house.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: Survivors of Nazi atrocities recognized Archbishop Trifa, former head of the Romanian Orthodox Church in America, as having directed a bloody attack against Jews during World War II. He was deported in 1984 and died three years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When a popular gym teacher is found dead of what appears to be an accidental gunshot wound, his family is suspicious. A tape recorded by the victim just before his death tells the true story of his strange marriage and his wife's insatiable greed.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: In this international case of extortion, murder and stolen identities, scam-artist Albert J. Walker assumes the identity of co-worker Ronald Platt. Platt later turns up dead in an ocean with an anchor tied around his torso.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: 6-year-old Nicole Rae Walker was killed in a hit-and-run in her Ft. Lauderdale neighborhood. The prosecutor combines the talents of an accident reconstruction expert with a video specialist to create a graphic demonstration of the moment of impact.

programme.title: Forensic Files - Season 5
programme.desc: When convenience store employee Wanda Mason is found dead, investigators find the entire murder has been caught on the store's security camera. But the image of the killer is so degraded it seems impossible to positively identify him.

programme.desc: Chandler Halderson is charged with the killing and dismemberment of his parents in Madison, WI.

programme.title: Knight of Swords
programme.desc: True-crime series are a staple of the TV landscape. "Corrupt Crimes" analyzes recent criminal cases through a combination of expert testimony and dramatic storytelling. From crimes like doping in sports to more serious offenses like murder, the series exposes what is really going on in each case. Exposing corruption across the United States is the goal of the series. Cases featured in the half-hour episodes include an ATM heist that resulted in nearly $45 million being stolen worldwide and the former Detroit Mayor Kwame Kilpatrick.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Airplane Walk Snake Face-off Car Launch" - Contestants retrieve a flag from the wing of a biplane at 4,000 feet, pluck plums from a water tank full of snakes and drive a car off a parking structure.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Bull Riding/Eat Brains/Zip Line" - Contestants ride a bull, eat cow brains and attempt to drop into a numbered lane at 40 miles per hour.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Boat Jump Swimming with the Fishes Flag Snag" - Contestants must jump between speeding boats, retrieve weights from a tank of rotting squid and climb a flag pole 20 stories up.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Helicopter Fire Drill Eat Rectum Ledge Walk" - Contestants must traverse a cargo net underneath a helicopter, eat pig rectums and walk an obstacle-strewn ledge 11 stories up.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Playmates Super Bowl Special" - Playboy Playmates walk a tightrope 10 stories up, eat strawberries from an insect-filled box and retrieve glow sticks from freezing water.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Blimp Climb Bobbing in Wax Worms Car Flip" - Contestants climb down the side of a blimp, bob for chicken feet in a vat of wax worms and flip a speeding car.

programme.title: Backcountry Outfitters in Texas & Midwest Whitetail Adventures in Illinois

programme.title: Catch Co. "Walking The Tightrope"
programme.desc: Ryan and JayPee aren't your typical anglers and Tight Rope Jigs aren't your average finesse jigs. Ryan and JayPee started making The Baby Firework Super Jig in their garage after noticing issues with other jigs they were fishing around the gnarly rocks of Lake Michigan. They needed a hard-hitting finesse jig that was designed to trigger more bites and still hold up to heavy cover and big fish. Catch Co. partnered with Ryan and JayPee to bring their fiery finesse jig to all anglers.

programme.title: Catch Co. "The Artist"
programme.desc: Chris has been custom painting bass lures for a decade. His style is bold. His iconic BUGZ crawfish is legendary and now available in the Bubonic BUGZ squarebill. Starting from using his last $26, to bringing his vision to the mainstream. His story is one of dedication and following your dreams. Catch Co. is proud to partner with Chris to bring his legendary patterns to everyone.

programme.title: Catch Co. "The Craftsman"
programme.desc: This is the story of legendary lure designer Mike "Triton" Bucca and his path to creating the Bull Shad, one of the most iconic hard bodied swimbaits of all time. The Bull Shad is a heavy duty, trophy hunting swimbait responsible for the catches of some of the biggest bass in the world. Mike Bucca and Catch Co. teamed up for an inside look at his journey of bringing the Bull Shad to life.

programme.title: Unchartered Up North S1:E1 "Mille Lacs"
programme.desc: In Part 1 of Unchartered Up North, we catch up with Jon, Alex, and Westin in Minnesota on the legendary Lake Mille Lacs in search of giant smallmouth bass. This is the first leg of a 3-day journey where the guys are competing in a series of challenges up north for trophy bass, good eats, and to learn more about what the locals love. The angler with the most points after 3 days of challenges will select the charity of their choice to receive a $1,000 donation, furnished by Catch Co., Lund, and Mercury.

programme.title: Nigellissima

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella starts with her take on the classic light and sunny yogurt pot cake, then her niece and nephew are recruited to make - and enjoy - a shortcut sausage meatball supper. programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella treats her friends to an Italian inspired supper of pork loin stuffed with Parma ham and oregano, served alongside her speedy mock mash and lazy person's vignarola.

programme.title: Nigellissima

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella reveals a secret passion for one of the tastes of Italy with her dark and deviant liquorice pudding before introducing us to the joys of fregola in a light, tomato-hued recipe of couscous with clams.

programme.desc: Nigella Lawson continues to share her passion for creating mouth-watering Italian food, treating her supper guests to a sumptuous feast of lamb chops with mint, chilli and golden potatoes, served alongside roasted red onions with fennel and basil.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Robert Jewell blows us away with a dish that combines coconut and crab.

programme.title: Mexican Fare
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison prepare tacos dorados, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews a must-have for home cooks: fire extinguishers. Science expert Dan Souza then gives a demonstration of fast-freezing liquid nitrogen, and test cook Erin McMurrer makes roasted poblano and black bean enchiladas for Bridget.

programme.title: Sous Vide for Everybody
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Bridget Sous Vide Seared Steaks. Equipment expert Adam Ried then reviews his top pick for sous vide machines, and test cook Elle Simone makes a show stopping sous vide staple: Soft-Poached Eggs.

programme.title: Backyard BBQ
programme.desc: On a hot summer's day, life doesn't get much better than a big, juicy, smoky slab of spicy, mouth-watering ribs. But more often than not, baby back ribs cooked at home come out tasting like dry shoe leather on a bone. Our goal was to produce flavorful, juicy, tender ribs that would be well worth the time, money, and effort.

programme.title: Summer Tomatoes
programme.desc: What's the best way to enjoy summer tomatoes? It's hard to argue with a recipe that goes something like this: Slice, salt, and serve. Still, there are times when you want to use tomatoes in more elaborate dishes, and gazpacho and a cheesy tart are two of our favorites.

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Some days you don't mind spending the morning preparing eggs or baking muffins. But rubbery omelets and dry, hockey puck muffins can make you wonder why you bothered. These brunch recipes are special enough to make you long for Sunday mornings.

programme.title: Appetizers
programme.desc: We like appetizers that deliver big flavor without much work. This means spiced nuts that are not overly sweet, spinach dip that is bold and creamy (not watery and insipid), and beef satay that is tender and vibrant.

programme.title: Grill-Roasted Beef Tenderloin
programme.desc: On occasion we break the bank and buy a beef tenderloin. The tender, buttery interior is the big draw, and the combination of a healthy dose of seasoning and the flavor from the charcoal grill is a perfect solution to an otherwise mild-tasting piece of meat.

programme.title: Grilled Pizza
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grill-one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: Barbecued Brisket and Corn Fritters
programme.desc: Summertime entertaining can often mean preparing food for groups. If you're looking for a main course to serve a crowd or want to give a new twist to a summer vegetable, we offer recipes for tender beef brisket and savory corn fritters.

programme.title: Beer Can Chicken Dinner
programme.desc: In this episode, we show how a few easy tricks can give an old standby, like roast chicken, a new lift.

programme.title: Chocolate Delights
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to making Foolproof All-Butter Pie Dough and Chocolate Cream Pie, and tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cocoa powder. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Julia a decadent Dark Chocolate Fudge Sauce.

programme.title: The Perfect Cookie
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Julia a festive recipe for Easy Holiday Sugar Cookies. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for parchment paper, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews silicone baking mats. Test cook Lan Lam then makes Bridget the Best Lemon Bars.

programme.title: Elegant Dinner Party
programme.desc: In this episode, Bridget and Julia uncover the secrets to the ultimate Braised Brisket with Pomegranate, Cumin, and Cilantro. In the Equipment Corner, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews his top pick for twist corkscrews. Finally, test cook Dan Souza makes a decadent Duchess Potato Casserole.

programme.title: Holiday Feast
programme.desc: Test cook Ashley Moore shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make a Crumb-Crusted Rack of Lamb that is perfect for the holidays. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried shows host Julia Collin Davison his top picks of electric knives. Finally, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make a showstopping Brussels Sprout Gratin.

programme.title: Soup for Dinner
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza and host Julia Collin Davison make Chicken Bouillabaisse, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of cinnamon, and then Julia and Bridget uncover the secrets to Avgolemono.

programme.title: How to Roast Everything
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia teach viewers how to make the ultimate Beef Tenderloin with Smoky Potatoes and Persillade Relish. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a turkey tasting. Gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews fat separators, and then test cook Dan Souza makes Turkey Breast en Cocotte with Pan Gravy.

programme.title: Comfort Food Done Right
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison and host Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to making a flavorful Double-Crust Chicken Pot Pie from scratch. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of creamy peanut butter. Finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Julia a delicious First Lady specialty, Cowboy Cookies.

programme.title: Graham Kerrs Kitchen - Sweet and Savory Toppings
programme.desc: The creamy delicious low-fat topping for many desserts used here by Graham in a melt-in-your-mouth Pear Fondue.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Empire Kitchen Pop’s for Italian Detroit Axe
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Musonda Mwila, Michael Sanders and Michelle Dritsan, who review bistro fare and craft cocktails at the Empire Kitchen true Italian fare with homemade pasta, of course, at Pop's for Italian and a casual menu of eats at the high-energy Detroit Axe restaurant.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Spicing Up Rice
programme.desc: Martin and his guest, Ming Tsai, kick off the evening with a “Mango Tango” and bring the house down by proving that rice doesn’t have to be the same old bland side dish.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Guillermo Thomas, Norman Van Aken, and Anne Quatrano
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pan-fried Soft-shell Crawfish and Eggplant, Pan-cooked Yellowtail with Garlic Mashed Potatoes, and Kona Coffee Ice Cream Sandwich. Restaurants include: The Hermitage Hotel in Nashville, Norman’s in Miami, and Bacchanalia in Atlanta.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Pork Chronicles
programme.desc: As opposed to the lean-is-better preference in America, Koreans love their pork full of fat and, incidentally, full of flavor. On this episode, Marja, her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, and an expert food blogger named Daniel eat classic pork barbeque at Heukdonga restaurant in Seoul made with Jeju’s famous black pigs.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Old Salts, Young Guns
programme.desc: When cousins Ryan and Travis Croxton revitalized the long formant family oyster business, they thought it would be a side gig. Today, they lead the nation’s bi-valve resurgence. Chef Jason Alley and his two kids head out on the Bay to harvest the bi‐valves and get a course in marine biology and learn how the oyster is playing a big part in cleaning up the Bay.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Seafood Minestrone
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking seafood minestrone, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pan-fried Soft-shell Crawfish and Eggplant, Pan-cooked Yellowtail with Garlic Mashed Potatoes, and Kona Coffee Ice Cream Sandwich. Restaurants include: The Hermitage Hotel in Nashville, Norman’s in Miami, and Bacchanalia in Atlanta.

programme.desc: When cousins Ryan and Travis Croxton revitalized the long formant family oyster business, they thought it would be a side gig. Today, they lead the nation’s bi-valve resurgence. Chef Jason Alley and his two kids head out on the Bay to harvest the bi‐valves and get a course in marine biology and learn how the oyster is playing a big part in cleaning up the Bay.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Beans and Lentils
programme.desc: Beans don't have to be boring! Try them in Minestrone Soup, French Lentil Salad, and Hummus.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Early German Settlers
programme.desc: As early as 1690, German settlers left Europe for religious freedom in the new world of North America. They settled in the Philadelphia area, and immediately started to contribute to the innovations and spirit of our new country. In this episode, Chef Walter Staib prepares ale-braised sausages and shows us how his German ancestors helped to make America great.

programme.title: Foodie Road Trip with Skye Estroff - The Sweet Life in Vidalia
programme.desc: Take a tour around Vidalia, GA to find southern comfort food, outrageous sandwiches, and homemade donuts. Skye uses local pecans in a family recipe.

programme.title: From Scratch - Whole Hog
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe visits a rum distillery and celebrates his birthday by roasting a whole pig.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - Last Flight Out Of Shanghai
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Chef Keiko Takahashi, the first Japanese woman in the world to win a Michelin star. She and her husband run Keiko on Nob Hill, a place that feels like a private club, and where the luxurious cooking has a distinct feminine style to it.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - A Dish to Name
programme.desc: Chef Stellino explores how to properly make and name a dish for someone special. Dishes Include: Maureen's Farro Salad / Gambero al Coccio (Shrimp in the shell cooked in wine) / Grandma's Braciole /Aunt Buliti's Strawberries ( a special twist on a fresh fruit cup featuring strawberries and oranges with a very special sauce).

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: Erwan travels to the gorgeous island of Palawan where he meets with the locals and learns about pearl farming.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: In this episode, Erwan travels to the remote area of Palanan in Isabela, where he meets the Dumagat tribe and learns how to catch an octopus the traditional way.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: Erwan learned how to catch crustaceans while growing up, but in Dumaguete, he discovers their unique regional approach to catching mud crabs.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: Apo Island is famous for its marine Sanctuary. Erwan meets environmentalists and learns about the Rainbow Runner fish.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: On the island of Mindoro, Erwan samples a traditional Filipino Adobo, made with an unlikely source of protein - locally caught fruit bats.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: Batanes, known for its breathtaking coastline, is home to the mataw fishermen clan. With their guidance, Erwan sets out to catch dorado by using flying fish as bait.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: In the mountainous region of Sagada, Erwan sets out to find out more about a local favorite smoked pork: Etag. Along the way, he meets a French chef, an Etag producer, and a local cook who teaches him about indigenous Igorot dishes.

programme.title: Origins
programme.desc: Known as the tiniest edible fish in the world, sinarapan are found in the many lakes covering the Bicol region. We follow Erwan as he attempts to catch these minuscule fish and see the many ways they can be prepared.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke meets up with his older brother, Lewis, and his cousin, Kristoff, in Paris, where his cousins have lived for decades and now run their own newly opened Vietnamese restaurant.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke inspects the first round of baguettes fresh from the oven, at an award winning bakery in central Paris.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke heads to Strasbourg where he develops a taste for all things Alsatian and samples a local tart flambé.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke seeks some French connections to his Vietnamese roots, making a chicken dish fusing the two cultures in the eastern region of Franche-Comté.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke explores Lyon, the food capital of France, making a classic salad Lyonnaise and celebrating local food culture.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: The Australian-Vietnamese chef heads to Marseille, cooking a fish soup fusion, a delicious salt and pepper cuttlefish, and a French-Vietnamese meal.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke Nguyen reaches Nice, where he discovers the best local produce and, naturally, attempts an authentic salad Nicoise.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Luke explores the south west, sampling Basque delicacies in Biarritz and oysters on the island of D'Oleron.

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's France
programme.desc: Chef Luke Nguyen's vibrant French tour continues around the oyster island of D'Oleron before he explores the food traditions of the Loire Valley.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Sydney
programme.desc: In this episode of No Reservations, Tony heads to Sydney to experience the enviable food and drink in the land down under. From the sheep farms of the blue mountains to the chic innovative restaurants of the big city, Sydney has recently become a mecca for meat-loving foodies. Tony eats fresh seafood, old school charcuterie, and the ubiquitous Australian barbie. In spite of the bad weather and presence of hipsters, the amazing meals make Tony want to look into local real estate.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Austin
programme.desc: Tony heads to Austin, Texas during South by Southwest - an international music festival. He hangs out with the band Sleigh Bells and enjoys roasted pig and crawfish with sausage followed by a tattoo given by the band's guitarist.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Burgundy
programme.desc: In Burgundy Tony & Chef Ludo stop at a wine cave for a night of drinking & singing with Ludo's friends. They drink wine & dig into crepes at a French truck stop, and visit a winery owned and operated by an American.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Dominican Republic
programme.desc: Tony makes a long overdue visit to the Dominican Republic. He joins filmmaker Juan Basanta for empanadas & nearly frozen beer, enjoys staples like fried salami with tostones & heads to Samana Peninsula by helicopter for lunch.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Emilia Romagna
programme.desc: In this episode of "No Reservations," Tony travels to Emilia Romagna, the breadbasket of Italy, with acclaimed New York Chef Michael White. In a red Ferrari California, the two travel across the region, sampling the foods that make this part of Italy great: culatello, balsamic vinegar, Sangiovese wine, and a variety of cheeses. Tony also dines at Ristorante San Domenico, a bastion of Italian noble cuisine, where Chef White apprenticed under acclaimed chef Gianluigi Morini.

programme.title: My Family and the Galapagos - Episode 1
programme.desc: As the Halls family settle into their new home, they quickly realize that the Galapagos islands are like nowhere else on Earth, a place where the remarkable wildlife views them as just another animal.

programme.title: My Family and the Galapagos - Episode 2
programme.desc: Monty investigates whether the Galapagos can cope with the demands of all the people who live and visit here, by uncovering the effects so many people are having on its delicate ecosystems.

programme.title: My Family and the Galapagos - Episode 3
programme.desc: In their last few weeks on Galapagos, the family investigate the fate of the ocean's most infamous creature - the shark - and the children go in search of one of Galapagos' most peculiar but compelling inhabitants, the marine iguana.

programme.title: Kung Fu Motion - Beijing Opera
programme.desc: Harry faces his toughest challenge yet as he puts aside his free-styling ways to conform to the precision moves required of the Monkey King character in Beijing Opera.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: David makes a rash promise to a client without first consulting James which could ultimately cost them the listing. Josh Altman snags a similar listing just blocks away from the Brits. Josh Flagg is stunned and saddened when Colton shows him the progress he's made remodeling his parents' house and childhood home.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Flagg struggles to find the balance between planning his over-the-top wedding and juggling over-the-top clients who give a whole new meaning to the word 'picky.' Tracy's got a new listing with a first-time developer who has high expectations and a whole lot of attitude! The Altmans race to the hospital as their baby daughter is born!

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Flagg lists a mid-century modern and must fight off developers looking to bulldoze the structure. Josh and Heather return home from their wedding and are up against a ticking clock to find their dream house.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Altman races against the clock after being thrown a curveball by his Bird Streets sellers. James and David experience difficulties with their Santa Monica gem as the sellers have their own ideas about price, and who the buyers should be.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh Altman tries to find the perfect home for a famous street artist who insists on going to every showing incognito. James and David go above and beyond to prove they're not the party boys they used to be in order to help old friends from London sell their Los Feliz home.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When David's brother Michael puts James And David to the task of finding him a development opportunity, they are led to the famed house where the movie "Mommie Dearest" was filmed.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: James and David make a pitch to represent the hottest new high rise building in Los Angeles. Tracy's client wants to sell her two properties in the Hollywood Hills, but has lofty expectations on price.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: James and David list the home of a sentimental seller, but when NBA star Kris Humphries shows interest, the Brits struggle to seal the deal. Josh Altman previews off-market listings to MLB's Brian Wilson, but his quirky demands throw Altman off his game.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: David and James throw a party as a last ditch effort to sell their St. Ives listing, but find that agents are just looking to take advantage of their client's financial situation.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: James works with Madison Hildebrand in Malibu to find a home for a young British millionaire with a fear of heights. programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Josh and Matt Altman land the biggest mansion in Bradbury Estates. Madison battles structural problems and mold to sell a friend's house in Brentwood.

programme.title: Million Dollar Listing: Los Angeles
programme.desc: James and David work with a long-time client Zach Vella to list an architectural gem, but Fredrik's arrival in Los Angeles is putting the pressure on them to get it sold.

programme.title: Flipping Boston: No Good Deed...
programme.desc: Big-hearted Dave helps his friend Johnny out of a tough situation by buying his old house to flip. When Pete discovers Dave paid too much without telling him, Pete storms off leaving Dave to handle the flip. As construction gets going, one hidden problem after another is revealed. Dave tries to find some creative ways to cut costs, but when he hires Johnny to do some tree removal, his profits come crashing down. If the guys can't work together and think fast, this deal may leave them in the red!

programme.title: Flipping Boston: The House That Dave Built

programme.title: Flipping Boston: The Salem Flip Trials
programme.desc: With their hands full on other projects, Dave and Peter decide the time is right to let their two prot g s, Scott and Andy, take the helm on a great new deal in Salem. They supply the junior flippers with all the tools they'll need to get the job done--their step-by-step guide to house flipping called "The Flipping Formula", but on Day 1 of their 30 day flip the newbies go off-book and the mistakes start mounting. Peter and Dave soon take hold of the reins but the clock is ticking as they try to whip the rookies into shape. When business calls Dave and Peter out of town can Scott and Andy adhere to the Formula? Or will this flip blow up in their faces?

programme.desc: Tempers flare at a pool party after spouses witness their mates interact with attractive strangers during a boot camp drill. Mark explodes in a jealous rage and Blanca goes berserk.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Bridezillas: A Maze And Confused
programme.desc: Spouses are thrown into a giant labyrinth to test their communication skills. Afterwards, couples expose the extensive damage fighting dirty has caused their marriages.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Bridezillas: Sex Is The Glue
programme.desc: Couples tackle their toughest sex and intimacy issues using puppets. Gloria tests Mark and Sofia reveals a bedroom secret that stuns the house.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Bridezillas: Leap Or Die Frying

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Bridezillas: The Lie Detector
programme.desc: Devastating lies are revealed when couples undergo a lie detector test. Julian is blindsided by Blanca's deception and destroys the house in a booze fueled rage. Shawn falls off the wagon.

programme.desc: The entire house erupts into a brawl after Shawn returns to the mansion drunk. Gloria pulls a knife and Sofia breaks her foot in the melee. The final ring ceremony is held and not every marriage survives.

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Let's Talk About Sam
programme.desc: Marriage is on the radar! JoJo is pressed to make a proposal. Meanwhile, Romeo's torn between Angela and Tee Tee. Egypt's bikini shoot turns left when her boyfriend, Sam tries to take over. Drama ignites when momager, Pepa, checks Egypt!

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Stays in Vegas What Heirs in Vegas
programme.desc: Kristinia moves to Sin City and throws a welcome party! The rivalry between Briana and Kristinia comes to a head. Tee Tee is blindsided when Romeo reveals that he has a secret crush on another woman! Panic strikes when Egypt and Sam run off to elope!

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Hard Times
programme.desc: Angela is shell-shocked when she suffers a major loss. Romeo runs to Angela's side. Boogie betrays his family to avoid his father, Dame. A family dispute between the Pepas comes to a head at Romeo's yacht party. A table is flipped and fists fly!

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Meet Your New Daddy
programme.desc: Angela is blindsided when Vanessa takes business matters into her own hands. Pepa's security guard turned boyfriend violates his new father figure role. A disgruntled Briana comes for Tee Tee. In a long-awaited reunion, Dame unleashes on Boogie!

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: This Ain't My First Rodeo
programme.desc: Boogie and Dame have a life-altering meet up. Sparks fly between Romeo and Angela. Angela avoids Vanessa at the racetrack and pushes Vanessa to her breaking point. A shocking scandal rocks Pepa's world when Aundre's past comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Don't Get It Twisted
programme.desc: Lil Twist brings trouble to Dame's Culture Vulture Event which threatens Sam. Meanwhile, Twist has eyes for Egypt. Romeo stands up to Master P and suffers the blowback. A scandal from Aundre's past emerges and jeopardizes Pepa's million-dollar deal.

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: The Battle of the Lil's
programme.desc: Romeo and Bow Wow face off in an epic battle of the Lil's! Pepa's conflicted between her career and her relationship. On a romantic stroll in New Orleans, Angela and Romeo take shocking next steps to move forward in their relationship.

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Wherefore Art Thou Romeo?
programme.desc: Angela and Romeo's double date backfires! Pepa's relationship with Aundre takes a turn for the worst. Tee Tee throws a singles party where an uninvited guest pops up with a vengeance. Sam and Lil Twist nearly come to blows over Egypt.

programme.title: Growing Up Hip Hop: Leave Me Alone
programme.desc: Romeo finds himself in troubled waters with Angela when he drops out of their double date. Dame confronts his nemesis. Pepa struggles with a broken heart. Master P warns Eric about digging up Eazy-E's death. Vanessa's birthday surprise.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 2 Chefs Compete" - The two finalists visit Chef Ramsay's New York City restaurant, where their signature dishes are judged by the executive chefs of Ramsay's other restaurants.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, Winner Announced" - The fourth season comes to a close as the finalists work together with previously eliminated contestants for the last dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 16 Chefs Compete" - Sixteen professional chefs compete for an executive chef position at the Borgata Hotel, Casino and Spa in Atlantic City. The contestants must wow Chef Ramsay with their signature dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 15 Chefs Compete" - Following the previous night's dinner service disaster, Chef Ramsay presents the aspiring chefs with the food that they wasted.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 14 Chefs Compete" - The fourteen remaining chefs visit a meat locker to learn about various cuts of beef, then put their knowledge into practice when Hell's Kitchen becomes a steak house for the night.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 13 Chefs Compete" - The thirteen remaining chefs must serve breakfast to fifty young football players and cheerleaders. However, one team runs out of eggs.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 12 Chefs Compete" - The twelve remaining candidates shop at an Asian market and prepare fusion dishes for Chef Ramsay and food writer Tanya Steel.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 11 Chefs Compete" - The eleven remaining chefs cook for a bar mitzvah, preparing gourmet variations on the guest of honor's three favorite dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 10 Chefs Compete" - The ten remaining chefs must make tapas from leftovers. At the dinner service, one chef's mistake nearly derails both teams.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 9 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay challenges the teams' palates in a blind taste test. In a packed dinner service, anxiety is higher than usual when celebrities Eric McCormack and Robert Patrick stop by.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Bella Luna
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay assists a family-owned Italian restaurant in Easton, Philadelphia that's struggling due to the chef's incompetence and the owner's aloofness.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Zayna Flaming Grill (Part One)
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay must whip a family-owned restaurant in Redondo Beach, California back into shape. Internal struggles and bland food hold Zayna Flaming Grill back.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Zayna Flaming Grill (Part Two)
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is caught in the crossfire as a family's feud threatens to close Zayna Flaming Grill for good.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited No. 9
programme.desc: To see if they've heeded his advice, Chef Ramsay checks up on La Galleria, the Olde Hitching Post and Prohibition Grille.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sebastian's
programme.desc: Sebastian's prepares frozen food from a complex menu and the wait staff is more concerned about auditioning for their acting roles than serving meals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Campania's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay heads to Fair Lawn, New Jersey to find a lackadaisical wait staff hurting the Italian restaurant Campania's.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Peter's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Peter's, a family-run Italian restaurant in Babylon, New York. He discovers that the eatery is sinking because of its brash manager and co-owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Trobiano's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay tries to help Italian restaurant Trobiano's. When Ramsay confronts the owner about the cleanliness of the kitchen and the tastiness of the food, tensions rise.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sabatiello's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Sabatiello's and finds a hot-headed owner who is deep in debt. The owner gets so angry at his employees and Ramsay's criticism that he shuts down the eatery himself.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Giuseppe's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay makes his way to Macomb Township, Michigan to inspect Giuseppe's, a family-run Italian restaurant afflicted with a bickering father-son duo and a shortage of customers.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "Keepin' It Classy " - It's back to school for the remaining eight designers in this fan-favorite Unconventional Materials Challenge to create high impact fashion from materials found in an elementary classroom. Guest judges are actors Michael Urie and Gabourey Sidibe.

programme.title: Project Runway All Stars
programme.desc: "The Art of Construction" - A construction site forces designers to create feminine fashion from masculine materials for the notorious Unconventional Materials Challenge. Snooki and JWoww join the judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Fashion Farm" - The designers are taken out of the city and onto a farm. There, they are put to the test to see how innovative they can be when presented with an unusual fabric choice.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Hard Wear" - The designers strap on their "tool belts" to show off their "construction" skills. But as they prepare for the Runway, each designer fears they may end up in the bottom.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''It's a Party'' - It's anything but party time when the designers get their Unconventional Materials Challenge: to make chic looks out of party supplies. But when the designers' models walk through the doors, the designers learn that there is a catch that may push them to their limits. The "Queen of Unconventional Fashion," Betsey Johnson, guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''My Pet Project'' - This year's Unconventional Materials Challenge lives up to its name when the designers arrive at a pet store. When Tim informs them that they will find all the materials they need inside, they quickly realize that this is their opportunity to show the judges how they can think outside the box. Stacey Bendet (Alice + Olivia) guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Candy Couture" - The designers participate in the always-anticipated Unconventional Materials Challenge of the season. This time around, the designers are tasked with making a garment entirely from items that are found in Dylan's Candy Bar.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Ultimate Hard and Soft" - The designers are tasked with the Unconventional Materials Challenge. Two of Project Runway's favorite challenges, the flower store and the hardware store, are combined for the ultimate "hard and soft" challenge. Also, the teams get a bit of a shake-up when two members leave one team and one member leaves another. The legendary Bette Midler serves as a guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "An Unconventional Coney Island" - The designers are taken to Coney Island and split into teams of two for the Yoplait Challenge. After asking patrons to describe different flavors of yogurt, they must then use these descriptive words as inspiration for their Runway look. The catch? The only fabric allowed in this challenge are from prizes they win at Coney Island.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "You Choose Your Materials!" - For their second Team Challenge of the season, the designers are divided into four teams of three and told they are making a 3-piece mini collection inspired by their assigned Lexus Sedan. However, this is also an Unconventional Materials Challenge, so the designers must drive their Lexus' to various predetermined locations of their choosing in order to shop for this challenge.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Rain, Snow and Rice" - At the Bauman's wedding in Connecticut, a snowstorm traps Ann, Don and their friends at the hotel, but only two rooms are available and Ann has no intention of sharing a bed with Donald.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Paper Hats and Everything" - While Ann expects a dinner date with her father to be a surprise birthday party, Judy assembles one on short notice just in case it isn't.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "What Are Your Intentions?" - Ann's father presses Donald as to whether he intends to marry his daughter.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "A Tenor's Loving Care" - A famous opera singer (Carroll O'Connor) makes a play for Ann while Don tries to get an interview with the temperamental celebrity.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Leaving the Nest Is for the Birds" - A family dinner put on by Ann to show that life in New York City is safe is spoiled by an alleged peeping Tom (Jerry Van Dyke).

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "You Have to Know Someone to Be Unknown" - Finding out that Broadway producer Harold J. Davis (Herbert Rudley) is seeking a fresh-faced unknown for his next play, Ann goes out of her way to get recognized by him.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Honeymoon Apartment" - Ann's cheap cousin (Warren Berlinger) and his brand new bride insist on using her apartment for their honeymoon.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "This Little Piggy Had a Ball" - While bowling with Donald just before she has to accept an award for another actress, Ann reads about another bowler who bowled with his toes...and makes the mistake of trying to do it herself.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Author, Author" - For an upcoming audition, Ann needs a comedic line and seeks help from both Donald and a washed-up comedy writer, neither of whom prove to be adequate.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Mating Game" - While working on an expose on the inner workings of a game show called "The Mating Game," Donald sends Ann to go undercover as a bachelorette.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Pass the Potatoes, Ethel Merman" - A walk-on role for a play starring Ethel Merman in a revival of "Gypsy" leaves Ann awestruck.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Good Skate" - Ann auditions for a soda commercial that requires a performance on roller skates, something she has a little difficulty with.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Black, White and Read All Over" - After yet another rejection of Donald's unpublished novel, Ann offers to submit it to her father, who knows a publisher who's a customer at his restaurant.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "To Each Her Own" - Donald does a news story on computer dating and takes Ann along for the ride. Much to Ann's chagrin, the girl that the computer dating service assigns to her boyfriend is a lot like her.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "The Apartment" - Donald gets Ann to house sit at his apartment, and she runs into another friend of his (Bill Bixby), who is also staying there.

programme.title: That Girl
programme.desc: "Absence Makes the Heart Grow Nervous" - Before Ann goes to Philadelphia for a play that's making a nationwide tour, Donald tries to show her a good time by giving her a night on the town...and another night...and another night...

programme.title: Portlandia: Winter In Portlandia
programme.desc: It's wintertime in Portlandia. Peter and Nance struggle to keep off winter weight by cutting pasta from their diets. Candace's son (Bobby Moynihan) visits Women and Women First bookstore for the holidays.

programme.title: Portlandia: Take Back Mtv
programme.desc: In this Season 3 premiere, Spyke & Iris join forces with a gang of former MTV stars to take back MTV from the Tweens. A group of frustrated college grads stage a protest on the dance floor. Sandra has a crush on a man in her meditation class.

programme.title: Portlandia: Missionaries
programme.desc: The Mayor sends Fred and Carrie on a door-to-door mission to Seattle to recruit new citizens for Portland. A pedicab driver hustles for clients. Peter and Nance prepare for the opening of their Bed and Breakfast with a visit to The Doily Shoppe.

programme.title: Portlandia: Nina'S Birthday
programme.desc: Nina goes to great lengths to throw an extravagant 32nd birthday party for herself. The daylong event is set to include activities ranging from horseback rides to sunrise yoga that will last well into the night.

programme.title: Portlandia: Squiggleman
programme.desc: Concerned parents Brendan and Michelle start a band that makes kids music. The Portland Nerd Council issues a Public Service Announcement. Malcolm & Kris have an uncomfortable lunch at a vegan restaurant. The Feminist Bookstore hosts a comedy night.

programme.title: Portlandia: Off The Grid
programme.desc: Following an environmental scandal, The Mayor steps down from office and moves off the grid. A dolphin discovers that plastic bags have been banned in Portland. Musicians compete in a Battle of the Gentle Bands.

programme.title: Portlandia: Feminist Bookstore 10th Anniversary
programme.desc: The 10th anniversary party for Toni and Candace's feminist bookstore is interrupted by a surprise guest. Guest stars Penny Marshall, LaMarcus Aldridge.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Drew Barth - Shoulda Tried Harder
programme.desc: Drew Barth is one of the fastest rising comedy stars in the Northwest. Born just outside the city of Seattle, what started as a dare in high school has become a full-time career. Drew Barth has risen through the ranks of local open mics to become a regular performer at comedy clubs, colleges, casinos and private events up and down the West Coast. After making the finals of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Drew Barth spent a great deal of time in Los Angeles performing at clubs such as The Comedy Store, Laugh Factory, and The Improv, honing his craft.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Seth Tippetts - Tall. Dark. Gigante
programme.desc: Get to know Seth from the chest down. He’s big, he’s tall, but most of all he’s hilarious. Check out this Utah-raised, clean, and semi-professional comedian today!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jeff Capri - Capricious
programme.desc: Jeff Capri uses his cynical perspective to riff on oxygen bars, playing darts to get in shape, and men taking their shirts off before fights.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Michael Palascak - 1984
programme.desc: Michael Palascak's dry humor shines with riffs on interviewing for a pyramid scheme, living with his parents after college, and how life is way better now than in 1984.

programme.title: Collin Moulton - Anti-Animal Vegan
programme.desc: Collin is one of the most fun, personable, and sought after headliners today. He has had his own stand-up special on SHOWTIME, he's been on NICKELODEON, and was recently featured on LAST CALL WITH CARSON DALY. Touring for over 15 years Collin has gained an ease and enjoyment on stage that makes every show worth watching.America knows and loves him. His familiarity and energy engages and relieves the audience before he even speaks. His electric storytelling style makes you care about every topic he explores. Collin's comedy is the release needed from our every day lives. Come needing to laugh tonight, leave wanting to laugh forever!Collin Moulton

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jordan Makin - The BFFG
programme.desc: Born and raised in the heart of Utah County, Jordan Makin had to compensate for his red hair and uneventful childhood by learning to be funny. His unique observations will make you laugh and his stories about feeling awkward will help you appreciate your life more. He has worked with many comedy greats, such as Marc Maron, Ryan Hamilton, and Drew Lynch. His comedy has been featured at the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival and the Idaho Laugh Fest. Jordan is the co-creator and co-host of The Happy Valley Podcast.

programme.title: Ron Ruhman - Weird Stuff
programme.desc: Ron has been called a “High Energy Seinfeld”. He brings a very energetic style to the stage as he shares his interesting slant on day-to-day life in an act that is clean, smart, and very entertaining.

programme.title: James Johann - Rurally Funny
programme.desc: James' childhood upbringing was significantly influenced by country music, countless bad hair cuts, and Catholic school. In 1991, James began his stand-up career in Kansas City. Today, James is a long-time veteran of the stand-up comedy circuit, performing at clubs across the country. His self-deprecating sense of humor and high energy style come together to create a unique onstage persona. James relies more on his brain than the profane and his comedy is a truthful and hilarious reflection of life as he sees it.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Aaron Woodall - Sad and Needy
programme.desc: Between his first and second special, Aaron Woodalls perspective transitioned from a nice young man coming to grips with a dirty, cynical world to a deeper introspection of his own upbringing and biases.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Tom Ryan - Off The Verge
programme.desc: Over the years Tom Ryan has worked steadily at comedy clubs, concert venues, corporate functions and colleges across the U.S.. He has also made national television appearances on Showtime, A&E Comedy Central, and… Three times on “The Late Show with David Letterman!”. He has performed as the opening act in concert for: B.B. King, Tim Allen, Steven Wright, Natalie Cole, and Dennis Miller just to name a few. He has contributed monologue jokes to the award winning "Politically Incorrect with Bill Maher" and regularly headlines corporate events for companies ranging from Coca-Cola to Church and Dwight. Tom believes that the best comedy comes from the most unlikely sources.

programme.title: Bob Smiley - Tartar Terrorist
programme.desc: In-demand stand up comedian known for his machine gun approach and hilarious, clean material.

programme.title: Matt Falk: Unlit
programme.desc: Matt Falk was called "effortlessly funny" by the CBC. He's performed at Just For Laughs, The Hal!fax Comedy Festival & the Winnipeg Comedy Festival.

programme.title: Robert G. Lee: Laughter's Still Legal
programme.desc: Robert has combined his Christian world view with his Monty Python sensibility.

programme.title: Scott Losse: Okay
programme.desc: Scott Losse is a stand-up comedian from Seattle, Washington.

programme.title: Tony Deyo: Sleep When the Baby Sleeps
programme.desc: Tony Deyo is a stand-up comedian known most notably for his sharp, quick material and near-perfect comedic timing.

programme.title: Doug Thompson: Who Taught You That?
programme.desc: Comedian Doug Thompson is a ray of light.

programme.title: Andy Forrester: Most of This Is Baby Fat
programme.desc: Andy Forrester's brand of off-the-wall humor has made him a fan favorite at clubs all over the country for almost 20 years.

programme.title: Lee Hardin: Not Quite a Grown-up
programme.desc: Lee Hardin is a comedian known for making bad decisions and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Jeff Shaw: Manly Girly Man
programme.desc: Jeff Shaw's writing is marked both by idealism and humanity. His stimulating satire is often infused with poetic beauty.

programme.title: Spencer King: Stay at Home Sad
programme.desc: Spencer is a husband, new father, and cat owner.

programme.title: Mike Brody: Not Afraid of Butterflies
programme.desc: Starting comedy on a whim at an open mic in the year 2000, Mike Brody has since devoted his life to perfecting the delivery of his high-energy act.

programme.title: Lamont Ferguson: You Had All Day
programme.desc: Ferguson has appeared on the Tonight Show, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed and ABC's Family Channel.

programme.title: Taylor Mason: Hysterical Perspective
programme.desc: Taylor Mason's career has taken him from Carnegie Hall to The Sydney Opera House, to countless television appearances and a million online "hits."

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Campbell's Soup The Magic Shelf
programme.desc: Dorrance, a chemist with the Campbell Soup Company invented condensed soup in 1897 and the broth world has never been the same. Join Bridget and Mary Jo from RiffTrax as they bring their comedic riffing treatment to this shocking soupy short.

programme.title: RiffTrax: The Guy from Harlem
programme.desc: The stars of Mystery Science Theater give their comedic riffing treatment to this Blaxploitation classic. oin Mike, Kevin, and Bill for The Guy From Harlem!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Behavior Of Domestic Pigs
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the educational short Behavior Of Domestic Pigs! Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they learn all about the Behavior Of Domestic Pigs!

programme.title: RiffTrax: Santa and the Ice Cream Bunny
programme.desc: The stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 give their comedic riffing treatment to this truly bizarre family Christmas movie! It’s one of the strangest and most baffling pieces of outsider art that Mike, Kevin and Bill have ever riffed. Please join us in experiencing: Santa & the Ice Cream Bunny.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Tale of Moose Baby
programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about Moose Baby! "But what is it about?" you quite reasonably ask. It is not about anything. It is Moose Baby. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for The Tale of Moose Baby!

programme.title: RiffTrax: Honor And Glory
programme.desc: The stars of Mystery Science Theater give their comedic riffing treatment to this martial arts flick starring Cythnia Rothrock. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for Honor And Glory!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Short: Shapes We Live With
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short all about spheres, cylinders and pyramids. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, you might just learn something (but only if you don’t know what a circle is). Don’t be a square, join Mike, Kevin, and Bill, the Riffers We Live With, for Shapes We Live With!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Star Games
programme.desc: Go to infinity and beyond (or at least, a forest) and join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for some Star Games! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of Mystery Science Theater 3000).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Tiny Astronaut
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to The Tiny Astronaut! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill and a bunch of mouse rocket enthusiasts for The Tiny Astronaut!
